subject: Authorities list: implement InstallAll & ReplaceAll
commitMessage:
Authorities list: implement InstallAll & ReplaceAll

This change implements the design in
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/49317.

InstallAll: enumerate all certs in the input file and install all of
them;
ReplaceAll: replace all certs with the new authorities list
Atomic: implemented via creating temporary folder and issuing swap.

Added ability to unit test service reload as well.

Tested:
1. Unit tests
2. Tested loading/deleting authorities list in QEMU.

```
root@xxx:~# busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.Manager.Authority.Ldap \
> /xyz/openbmc_project/certs/authority/ldap \
> xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.InstallAll \
> InstallAll s /tmp/trust_bundle.pem
as 3 "/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/authority/ldap/1"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/authority/ldap/2"
"/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/authority/ldap/3"
root@xxx:~# ls /etc/ssl/certs/authority/
10a5d8b0.0  5b49ceaa.0	f3ddaa86.0  file0qmgPV	fileDbjTzW  fileR4TtjO
trust_bundle
root@xxx:~# busctl call
xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.Manager.Authority.Ldap
/xyz/openbmc_project/certs/authority/ldap
xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.ReplaceAll ReplaceAll s /tmp/trust_bundle.pem
root@xxx:~# ls /etc/ssl/certs/authority/
10a5d8b0.0  5b49ceaa.0	f3ddaa86.0  file1obsEZ	fileOqVoaC  filerUBZCj
trust_bundle
```

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 6ec13c8f759962d29c0ac3a69b64de705116065d

This is commented on purpose. 

I will enable the two interfaces once https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/50045 is merged.
Done. The interface has been merged.
This performs a lot of logic but doesn't return anything. I am worried about error handling. E.g. if we fail to write to file, I would like the dbus API to return an error. Would it be possible?

Yes, we use exceptions in the OpenBMC stack. The DBus framework we have in OpenBMC will catch those exception and inform the clients corresponding errors. 

These errors are in https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/phosphor-dbus-interfaces/+/50045 and specified in the "errors" section.

```
      errors:
        - xyz.openbmc_project.Common.Error.InternalFailure
        - xyz.openbmc_project.Certs.Error.InvalidCertificate
        - xyz.openbmc_project.Common.Error.NotAllowed

```
nit: params names mismatch (sourceFilePath vs certSrcFilePath). Also add ||?

Done.

This codebase is using docgen style IIUC, which doesn't add ||.

optional: file IO in C++ is ugly. I recommend encapsulating it in a separate set of utils, e.g. feel free to copy https://gbmc-internal.git.corp.google.com/prodid-securityd/+/refs/heads/master/file_io_util.cc

at the very least, add inputCertFileStream.close()

Done. Good catch!

I will do file IO related clean up in a separate CL. The examples you linked are in Return Code stack, but it should be applicable in exception stack as well.
should it return early if an error is detected?

elog<InternalFailure>() will throw an exception and codes jumps to some internal exception handling blocks.

So yes, it returns early at the `elog` lines.
Can you please explain the mechanics of how Cert Manager updates the gRPC daemons with the new trust bundle?

Oh, I missed the notification. Added. Good catch.

I also enabled unit test to verify this service notification
Will DeleteAll be implemented in a separate CL?
It is implemented here. See the override `replaceAll` class method.
can this be a const ref / string_view? Or is the interface auto generated?
The interface is auto generated.
Apologize for the late reply. I am back to focus on these changes. PTAL
nit: parameter naming, ordering (installFilePath vs sourceFilePath vscertFilePath )
Done
For my understanding: how does this work? What does it watch?

This is not related to authority manager and not planed to be used in any Google's cases as well. 

See https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-certificate-manager/blob/master/certs_manager.cpp#L127; authority manager won't initialize the watch

For other types of managers, we monitor the install dir via inotify, if any new cert is added, we refresh currently installed certs and notify consumers.
const ref would avoid an extra copy here
Done
nit: weird to see a mix of iterative and functional programming. Prefer `for (const auto& cert : installedCerts)` for consistency with the prev blocks.
Done
Can you add a test for DeleteAll?
Done

Dear maintainers, PTAL.

One of my colleagues have reviewed the change.
I managed to review partially will complete the rest tomorrow
need sometime to correlate things
Thanks! Changed and replied accordingly.
internal::CertificateInterface(bus, objPath.c_str(), true),
Done. Yeah, thanks. These codes are written before we have the internal alias.
is this required? i assume you want sstream
You are right, this is for my debug print. Removed.
all these are already there in the header file, do we need to include them again?
nope. After using the internal alias, we are good here.
same as above
Done
not sure std::string_view is good here, auto would have let the compiler pick the best one.

string_view gives us size. It also works well with string.find() without copying the actual buffer.

I tried auto, which doesn't work.

```
...
pem.find(beginCertificate, begin); // this line compiles with auto 
...
end += endCertificate.size(); // while this line doesn't
```
thanks for th explanation, now it makes sense.

x509list may be certsList? or certificatesList

this is no way related to x509, my assumption?
Done
didn;t understand what is this for? why is begin set again?
added a comment explaining the logic.
block?
changed to identifier.

as this message is displayed to the user should it be more generic? 
"Install all not supported for authority certificates"
Done
this check can go to line 290 that way we need not execute logic from 292 to 301
Done
this can go after line 297 that way we need not execute code from 299 to 301 in failure
Done
is it remove or removeall

It is remove. It is a single file. Individual certs will be handled by `installedCerts.clear()`.

Ideally we don't have other files in the directory, other than a single authorities list file, a serials of split single certs and their file aliases.
this List name is confusing, it is a path can;t we use some other name for the variable
Done. changed to authoritiesListFilePath
is this filename or path name?
this is filename, like "a.pem".
is this to delete files that are copied from older releases? is it a file we are deleting or path? we could use fs::remove for file?

we want also remove directories if any. But ideally we don't have other files in the directory, other than a single authorities list file, a serials of split single certs and their file aliases.

I bet internally remove_all checks if the given |path| is a file. So it should be cheap to call remove_all in general.
why this became virtual? I guess we do not have any derived classes from certs_manager?

This is for unit test. Valentine found a bug that I actually forgot to invoke "reloadOrReset" in InstallAll.

As the commit message states, "Added ability to unit test service reload as well."

Are you worried about https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/cplusplus/OOP50-CPP.+Do+not+invoke+virtual+functions+from+constructors+or+destructors? The only data shared in "reloadOrReset" is the bus connection, and it is initialized in base class. I believe we are safe.

1) Please test restoring of certificates by creating few and restarting the serivce and ensure certificates are loaded back

2) Code getting complicated, it started with small server and client certificate install and is bloating, may be time to split into multiple managers probably.
i see restore path is tested by unit test, please ignore the comment

For 2), yes, I plan to do two clean ups in the future,

1. get a Manager interface and all types of Manager are just different derived classes; this way we don't need all those branches around Manager types.
2. add a file util library.

I am working on introducing another type of Manager: Certificate Revocation List (CRL). So the cleanup 1 becomes more necessary. Will add you on the design review of CRL.
nice one, forgot that first condition "begin = pem.find(beginCertificate, begin)" is executed only once.
Ack
why temppath and temp objects, is it to ensure that upon failure we do not install partial certificates?
Yes. That's part of the design. If the last cert fails, we won't the previous ones. Rollback is hard so we use this temppath method
is testing for restoring of certificates done?
saw test case and looks good.
thanks
if we are returning from line 943 this code will never execute, should we delete?

No, we need them for the normal authority recovery (single file based).

If you look at line 930, we have a strict check "fs::exists(authoritiesListFilePath)".
Ack. :)
good test, instead of bypassing the method we are mocking and ensuring that it is called?
Yeah, since there's not a very good way to test systemd method calls, instead we just ensure the reload function was called.
are we checking here that reloadOrReset is called with this service name? for my understanding

Yes, Eq is a matcher, it ensures we reload the correct service.

If you check this string value to something else, the unit test will fail.
stringstream not used in the newly added code
Done. Good catch.
extra space
Done. It's actually a bug, we should use semicolon instead of comma at line 241. Good catch!
this check can go to line 232 that way we need not create cert pointer
Done
do not see vector added in this file
Done. Good catch.
sorry for the delay, the code was there long time for review.
Friendly ping, can this be merged now?
Friendly ping for +2, it has been two weeks without additional comments :)

Devender,

What is this waiting for?  I'm assuming it can merge?
please socre i need another +1 or will check with jayanth

Ed is not directly involved in the implementation. He +1ed the design https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/docs/+/49317.

Valentin has reviewed this change in details and +1ed it. He represents the team which is the consumer of this feature.

Could you help check with jayanth?
Friendly ping
Done. I will wait for a day to see if there are any more comments
Waited for a work day and no comments. Will +2 and submit. Feel free to reach out to me if anyone has any comment.
